TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Process extends System.ComponentModel.Component

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Diagnostics.MonitoringDescription("Provides access to local and remote processes, enabling starting and stopping of local processes.")

summary.span: 提供对本地和远程进程的访问权限并使你能够启动和停止本地系统进程。

span.span: Provides access to local and remote processes and enables you to start and stop local system processes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 组件提供对计算机上运行的进程的访问。A component provides access to a process that is running on a computer. 最简单的过程是正在运行的应用程序。A process, in the simplest terms, is a running app. 线程是操作系统向其分配处理器时间的基本单元。A thread is the basic unit to which the operating system allocates processor time. 线程可以执行进程的任何代码部分，包括当前由另一个线程执行的部分。A thread can execute any part of the code of the process, including parts currently being executed by another thread. 组件是用于启动、停止、控制和监视应用程序的有用工具。The component is a useful tool for starting, stopping, controlling, and monitoring apps. 您可以使用 组件获取正在运行的进程的列表，也可以启动新的进程。You can use the component, to obtain a list of the processes that are running, or you can start a new process. 组件用于访问系统进程。A component is used to access system processes. 初始化 组件后，可以使用它来获取有关正在运行的进程的信息。After a component has been initialized, it can be used to obtain information about the running process. 此类信息包括一组线程、已加载的模块（.dll 和 .exe 文件）以及性能信息，如进程正在使用的内存量。Such information includes the set of threads, the loaded modules (.dll and .exe files), and performance information such as the amount of memory the process is using. 此类型实现 接口。This type implements the interface. 在使用完类型后，您应直接或间接释放类型。When you have finished using the type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接释放类型，请在 `try`/ 块中调用其 `finally` 方法。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`finally` block. 若要间接释放类型，请使用 `using`（在 C# 中）或 `Using`（在 Visual Basic 中）等语言构造。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 有关详细信息，请参阅 接口主题中的“使用实现 IDisposable 的对象”一节。For more information, see the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. > [!NOTE] > 32位进程无法访问64位进程的模块。32-bit processes cannot access the modules of a 64-bit process. 如果尝试从32位进程获取有关64位进程的信息，将会出现 异常。If you try to get information about a 64-bit process from a 32-bit process, you will get a exception. 另一方面，64位进程可以访问32位进程的模块。A 64-bit process, on the other hand, can access the modules of a 32-bit process. 进程组件同时获取有关一组属性的信息。The process component obtains information about a group of properties all at once. 在 组件获取了有关任何组中的一个成员的信息后，它将缓存该组中其他属性的值，而不获取有关组中其他成员的新信息，直到您调用 方法。After the component has obtained information about one member of any group, it will cache the values for the other properties in that group and not obtain new information about the other members of the group until you call the method. 因此，属性值不能保证比最后一次调用 方法更新。Therefore, a property value is not guaranteed to be any newer than the last call to the method. 组细目依赖于操作系统。The group breakdowns are operating-system dependent. 如果在系统中使用引号声明了路径变量，则在启动在该位置找到的任何进程时必须完全限定该路径。If you have a path variable declared in your system using quotes, you must fully qualify that path when starting any process found in that location. 否则，系统将找不到该路径。Otherwise, the system will not find the path. 例如，如果 `c:\mypath` 不在你的路径中，而你使用引号添加它： `path = %path%;"c:\mypath"`，则在启动时必须完全限定 `c:\mypath` 中的任何进程。For example, if `c:\mypath` is not in your path, and you add it using quotation marks: `path = %path%;"c:\mypath"`, you must fully qualify any process in `c:\mypath` when starting it. 系统进程通过其进程标识符在系统上唯一标识。A system process is uniquely identified on the system by its process identifier. 与许多 Windows 资源一样，进程也由其句柄标识，该进程在计算机上可能不唯一。Like many Windows resources, a process is also identified by its handle, which might not be unique on the computer. 句柄是资源标识符的一般术语。A handle is the generic term for an identifier of a resource. 操作系统将保留进程句柄，该句柄通过 组件的 属性访问，即使进程已退出也是如此。The operating system persists the process handle, which is accessed through the property of the component, even when the process has exited. 因此，你可以获取进程的管理信息，例如 （通常为零表示成功或非零错误代码）和 。Thus, you can get the process's administrative information, such as the (usually either zero for success or a nonzero error code) and the . 句柄是一个极其宝贵的资源，因此泄漏句柄比泄漏内存更 virulent。Handles are an extremely valuable resource, so leaking handles is more virulent than leaking memory. > [!NOTE] > 此类包含应用于所有成员的类级别的链接要求和继承要求。This class contains a link demand and an inheritance demand at the class level that applies to all members. 当直接调用方或派生类不具有完全信任权限时，将引发 。A is thrown when either the immediate caller or the derived class does not have full-trust permission. 有关安全要求的详细信息，请参阅[链接需求](~/docs/framework/misc/link-demands.md)。For details about security demands, see [Link Demands](~/docs/framework/misc/link-demands.md). ## [!INCLUDE[net_core](~/includes/net-core-md.md)] 说明Notes 在 .NET Framework 中， 类在默认情况下使用 编码，通常为输入、输出和错误流的代码页编码。In the .NET Framework, the class by default uses encodings, which are typically code page encodings, for the input, output, and error streams. 例如，在区域性为英语（美国）的系统上，代码页437是 类的默认编码。For example code, on systems whose culture is English (United States), code page 437 is the default encoding for the class. 但 [!INCLUDE[net_core](~/includes/net-core-md.md)] 只能提供这些编码的有限子集。However, [!INCLUDE[net_core](~/includes/net-core-md.md)] may make only a limited subset of these encodings available. 如果是这种情况，它将使用 作为默认编码。If this is the case, it uses as the default encoding. 如果 对象依赖于特定的代码页编码，仍可以在调用任何 方法*之前*执行以下操作，使其可用：If a object depends on specific code page encodings, you can still make them available by doing the following *before* you call any methods: 1. 将对代码页程序集的引用添加到你的项目。Add a reference to the System.Text.Encoding.CodePages.dll assembly to your project. 2. 检索 属性中的 对象。Retrieve the object from the property. 3. 将 对象传递到 方法，以使编码提供程序支持的其他编码可用。Pass the object to the method to make the additional encodings supported by the encoding provider available. 如果在调用任何 方法之前已注册了编码提供程序，则 类将自动使用默认系统编码，而不是 UTF8。The class will then automatically use the default system encoding rather than UTF8, provided that you have registered the encoding provider before calling any methods. ## Examples 下面的示例使用 类的实例来启动进程。The following example uses an instance of the class to start a process. [!code-cpp[Process.Start_instance#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process.Start_instance/CPP/processstart.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Process.Start_instance#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process.Start_instance/CS/processstart.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Process.Start_instance#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process.Start_instance/VB/processstart.vb#1)] 下面的示例使用 类本身和静态 方法来启动进程。The following example uses the class itself and a static method to start a process. [!code-cpp[Process.Start_static#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process.Start_static/CPP/processstartstatic.cpp)] [!code-csharp[Process.Start_static#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process.Start_static/CS/processstartstatic.cs)] [!code-vb[Process.Start_static#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process.Start_static/VB/processstartstatic.vb)] 下面F#的示例定义了一个 `runProc` 函数，该函数启动进程、捕获所有输出和错误信息，并记录进程已运行的毫秒数。The following F# example defines a `runProc` function that starts a process, captures all output and error information, and records the number of milliseconds that the process has run. `runProc` 函数有三个参数：要启动的应用程序的名称、要为应用程序提供的参数以及起始目录。The `runProc` function has three parameters: the name of application to launch, the arguments to supply to the application, and the starting directory. [!code-fsharp[System.Diagnostics.Process#1](~/samples/snippets/fsharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.diagnostics.process/fs/Start1.fs#1)] `runProc` 函数的代码由[ImaginaryDevelopment](http://fssnip.net/authors/ImaginaryDevelopment)编写，并在[Microsoft 公共许可证](https://opensource.org/licenses/ms-pl)下提供。The code for the `runProc` function was written by [ImaginaryDevelopment](http://fssnip.net/authors/ImaginaryDevelopment) and is available under the [Microsoft Public License](https://opensource.org/licenses/ms-pl).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果未指定 属性，则默认为本地计算机（"."）。If you do not specify the property, the default is the local computer, ("."). 有两个选项可用于将新的 组件与计算机上的进程相关联。You have two options for associating a new component with a process on the computer. 第一种方法是使用构造函数创建 组件、设置 属性的相应成员并调用 ，将 与新的系统进程相关联。The first option is to use the constructor to create the component, set the appropriate members of the property and call to associate the with a new system process. 第二种方法是使用 或 返回值之一将 与正在运行的系统进程关联。The second option is to associate the with a running system process by using or one of the return values. 如果你使用 方法的 `static` 重载来启动新系统进程，则该方法将创建新的 组件并将其与进程关联。If you use a `static` overload of the method to start a new system process, the method creates a new component and associates it with the process. 如果将 属性设置为其默认值，则 `true`，你可以以与使用 Windows `Start` 菜单的 `Run` 对话框相同的方式启动应用程序和文档。When the property is set to its default value, `true`, you can start applications and documents in a way that is similar to using the `Run` dialog box of the Windows `Start` menu. `false` 时，只能启动可执行文件。When is `false`, you can start only executables. 可以通过以下两种方式之一来启动可从命令行调用的可执行文件：设置 属性的相应成员并调用不带参数的 方法，或通过将相应参数传递到 `static` 成员。Any executable file that you can call from the command line can be started in one of two ways: by setting the appropriate members of the property and calling the method with no parameters, or by passing the appropriate parameter to the `static` member. 您可以通过使用构造函数、静态 重载之一或任意 、或 方法创建 组件。You can create a component by using the constructor, one of the static overloads, or any of the , , or methods. 完成此操作后，就可以查看关联的进程。After you have done so, you have a view into the associated process. 这不是动态视图，当进程属性在内存中更改时，它会自动更新自身。This is not a dynamic view that updates itself automatically when the process properties have changed in memory. 相反，你必须为组件调用 ，以更新应用程序中的 属性信息。Instead, you must call for the component to update the property information in your application.

summary.span: 获取关联进程的基本优先级。

span.span: Gets the base priority of the associated process.

value.span: 基本优先级，从关联进程的 计算。

span.span: The base priority, which is computed from the of the associated process.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 进程的 是在关联进程中创建的线程的启动优先级。The of the process is the starting priority for threads created within the associated process. 你可以通过系统监视器的优先级基准计数器查看有关基本优先级的信息。You can view information about the base priority through the System Monitor's Priority Base counter. 根据所用的时间或其他提升，操作系统可以在进程应置于其他位置时更改基本优先级。Based on the time elapsed or other boosts, the operating system can change the base priority when a process should be placed ahead of others. 利用 属性，您可以查看分配给进程的启动优先级。The property lets you view the starting priority assigned to a process. 但是，因为它是只读的，所以不能使用 来设置进程的优先级。However, because it is read-only, you cannot use the to set the priority of the process. 若要更改优先级，请使用 属性。To change the priority, use the property. 使用系统监视器可查看 ，而 则不可见。The is viewable using the System Monitor, while the is not. 可以通过编程方式查看 和 。Both the and the can be viewed programmatically. 下表显示 值和 值之间的关系。The following table shows the relationship between values and values. |BasePriorityBasePriority|PriorityClassPriorityClass| |------------------|-------------------| |44|| |88|| |1313|| |2424|| ## Examples 下面的示例启动记事本的实例。The following example starts an instance of Notepad. 然后，该示例检索并显示关联进程的各种属性。The example then retrieves and displays various properties of the associated process. 该示例在进程退出时进行检测，并显示该进程的退出代码。The example detects when the process exits, and displays the process's exit code. [!code-cpp[Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64/VB/source.vb#1)]

summary.span: 在应用程序的重定向 流上开始进行异步读取操作。

span.span: Begins asynchronous read operations on the redirected stream of the application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 流可以同步或异步读取。The stream can be read synchronously or asynchronously. 、和 等方法执行进程的错误输出流上的同步读取操作。Methods such as , , and perform synchronous read operations on the error output stream of the process. 在关联的 写入其 流或关闭流之前，这些同步读取操作不会完成。These synchronous read operations do not complete until the associated writes to its stream, or closes the stream. 与此相反， 会对 流启动异步读取操作。In contrast, starts asynchronous read operations on the stream. 此方法将为流输出启用指定的事件处理程序，并立即返回到调用方，当流输出定向到事件处理程序时，该处理程序可以执行其他操作。This method enables the designated event handler for the stream output and immediately returns to the caller, which can perform other work while the stream output is directed to the event handler. 按照以下步骤对 的 执行异步读取操作：Follow these steps to perform asynchronous read operations on for a : 1. 将 设置为 `false`。Set to `false`. 2. 将 设置为 `true`。Set to `true`. 3. 向 事件添加事件处理程序。Add your event handler to the event. 事件处理程序必须与 委托签名匹配。The event handler must match the delegate signature. 4. 启动 。Start the . 5. 为 调用 。Call for the . 此调用启动 上的异步读取操作。This call starts asynchronous read operations on . 当异步读取操作开始时，每次关联 将一行文本写入其 流时，将调用事件处理程序。When asynchronous read operations start, the event handler is called each time the associated writes a line of text to its stream. 可以通过调用 取消异步读取操作。You can cancel an asynchronous read operation by calling . 读取操作可由调用方或事件处理程序取消。The read operation can be canceled by the caller or by the event handler. 取消后，可以再次调用 以恢复异步读取操作。After canceling, you can call again to resume asynchronous read operations. > [!NOTE] > 不能对重定向的流混合使用异步和同步读取操作。You cannot mix asynchronous and synchronous read operations on a redirected stream. 在异步或同步模式下打开 的重定向流后，对该流进行的所有进一步读取操作都必须处于相同的模式下。Once the redirected stream of a is opened in either asynchronous or synchronous mode, all further read operations on that stream must be in the same mode. 例如，不要在 流的 调用 ，反之亦然。For example, do not follow with a call to on the stream, or vice versa. 但是，可以在不同模式下读取两个不同的流。However, you can read two different streams in different modes. 例如，可以调用 ，然后调用 流的 。For example, you can call and then call for the stream. ## Examples 以下示例使用 `net view` 命令列出远程计算机上可用的网络资源。The following example uses the `net view` command to list the available network resources on a remote computer. 用户以命令行参数的形式提供目标计算机名称。The user supplies the target computer name as a command-line argument. 用户还可以提供错误输出的文件名。The user can also supply a file name for error output. 该示例收集 net 命令的输出，等待进程完成，然后将输出结果写入控制台。The example collects the output of the net command, waits for the process to finish, and then writes the output results to the console. 如果用户提供了可选的错误文件，则该示例会将错误写入文件。If the user supplies the optional error file, the example writes errors to the file. [!code-cpp[Process_AsyncStreams#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/process_asyncstreams/CPP/net_async.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[Process_AsyncStreams#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/process_asyncstreams/CS/net_async.cs#2)] [!code-vb[Process_AsyncStreams#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/process_asyncstreams/VB/net_async.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 流可以同步或异步读取。The stream can be read synchronously or asynchronously. 、和 等方法在进程的输出流上执行同步读取操作。Methods such as , , and perform synchronous read operations on the output stream of the process. 在关联的 写入其 流或关闭流之前，这些同步读取操作不会完成。These synchronous read operations do not complete until the associated writes to its stream, or closes the stream. 与此相反， 会对 流启动异步读取操作。In contrast, starts asynchronous read operations on the stream. 此方法将为流输出启用指定的事件处理程序，并立即返回到调用方，当流输出定向到事件处理程序时，该处理程序可以执行其他操作。This method enables a designated event handler for the stream output and immediately returns to the caller, which can perform other work while the stream output is directed to the event handler. 按照以下步骤对 的 执行异步读取操作：Follow these steps to perform asynchronous read operations on for a : 1. 将 设置为 `false`。Set to `false`. 2. 将 设置为 `true`。Set to `true`. 3. 向 事件添加事件处理程序。Add your event handler to the event. 事件处理程序必须与 委托签名匹配。The event handler must match the delegate signature. 4. 启动 。Start the . 5. 为 调用 。Call for the . 此调用启动 上的异步读取操作。This call starts asynchronous read operations on . 当异步读取操作开始时，每次关联 将一行文本写入其 流时，将调用事件处理程序。When asynchronous read operations start, the event handler is called each time the associated writes a line of text to its stream. 可以通过调用 取消异步读取操作。You can cancel an asynchronous read operation by calling . 读取操作可由调用方或事件处理程序取消。The read operation can be canceled by the caller or by the event handler. 取消后，可以再次调用 以恢复异步读取操作。After canceling, you can call again to resume asynchronous read operations. > [!NOTE] > 不能对重定向的流混合使用异步和同步读取操作。You cannot mix asynchronous and synchronous read operations on a redirected stream. 在异步或同步模式下打开 的重定向流后，对该流进行的所有进一步读取操作都必须处于相同的模式下。Once the redirected stream of a is opened in either asynchronous or synchronous mode, all further read operations on that stream must be in the same mode. 例如，不要在 流的 调用 ，反之亦然。For example, do not follow with a call to on the stream, or vice versa. 但是，可以在不同模式下读取两个不同的流。However, you can read two different streams in different modes. 例如，可以调用 ，然后调用 流的 。For example, you can call and then call for the stream. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何对 `sort` 命令的重定向 流执行异步读取操作。The following example illustrates how to perform asynchronous read operations on the redirected stream of the `sort` command. `sort` 命令是一种控制台应用程序，用于读取和排序文本输入。The `sort` command is a console application that reads and sorts text input. 该示例创建 `SortOutputHandler` 事件处理程序的事件委托，并将其与 事件关联。The example creates an event delegate for the `SortOutputHandler` event handler and associates it with the event. 事件处理程序从重定向的 流接收文本行，设置文本格式，并将文本写入屏幕。The event handler receives text lines from the redirected stream, formats the text, and writes the text to the screen. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法会使进程在等待时停止等待退出，并关闭进程句柄，并清除特定于进程的属性。The method causes the process to stop waiting for exit if it was waiting, closes the process handle, and clears process-specific properties. 不会在外部引用标准输出、输入和错误读取器和编写器时关闭它们。 does not close the standard output, input, and error readers and writers in case they are being referenced externally. > [!NOTE] > 方法调用 。The method calls . 将 对象置于 `using` 块会释放资源，而无需调用 。Placing the object in a `using` block disposes of resources without the need to call . ## Examples 下面的示例启动记事本的实例。The following example starts an instance of Notepad. 然后，它会以2秒的间隔检索关联进程的物理内存使用率，最大值为10秒。It then retrieves the physical memory usage of the associated process at 2-second intervals for a maximum of 10 seconds. 该示例检测进程是否在10秒后退出。The example detects whether the process exits before 10 seconds have elapsed. 如果10秒后仍在运行，则此示例将关闭进程。The example closes the process if it is still running after 10 seconds. summary.span: 通过向进程的主窗口发送关闭消息来关闭拥有用户界面的进程。

span.span: Closes a process that has a user interface by sending a close message to its main window.

returns.span: 如果成功发送了关闭消息，则为 ；如果关联进程没有主窗口或禁用了主窗口(例如，如果当前显示模式对话框)，则为 。

span.span: if the close message was successfully sent; if the associated process does not have a main window or if the main window is disabled (for example if a modal dialog is being shown).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 进程执行时，其消息循环处于等待状态。When a process is executing, its message loop is in a wait state. 每次操作系统将 Windows 消息发送到该进程时，消息循环都会执行。The message loop executes every time a Windows message is sent to the process by the operating system. 调用 将发送一个请求来关闭主窗口，该窗口在格式正确的应用程序中将关闭子窗口，并为应用程序撤消所有正在运行的消息循环。Calling sends a request to close the main window, which, in a well-formed application, closes child windows and revokes all running message loops for the application. 通过调用 退出进程的请求不会强制应用程序退出。The request to exit the process by calling does not force the application to quit. 应用程序可以在退出前要求用户进行验证，也可以拒绝退出。The application can ask for user verification before quitting, or it can refuse to quit. 若要强制退出应用程序，请使用 方法。To force the application to quit, use the method. 的行为与用户使用系统菜单关闭应用程序的主窗口的行为相同。The behavior of is identical to that of a user closing an application's main window using the system menu. 因此，通过关闭主窗口来退出进程的请求不会强制立即退出。Therefore, the request to exit the process by closing the main window does not force the application to quit immediately. 如果调用 ，则进程编辑的数据或分配给进程的资源可能会丢失。Data edited by the process or resources allocated to the process can be lost if you call . 导致异常进程终止，只应在必要时使用。 causes an abnormal process termination, and should be used only when necessary. 可以有序终止进程，并关闭所有窗口，因此更适合使用接口的应用程序。 enables an orderly termination of the process and closes all windows, so it is preferable for applications with an interface. 如果 失败，则可以使用 终止进程。If fails, you can use to terminate the process. 是终止没有图形界面的进程的唯一方法。 is the only way to terminate processes that do not have graphical interfaces. 只能对在本地计算机上运行的进程调用 和 。You can call and only for processes that are running on the local computer. 不能使远程计算机上的进程退出。You cannot cause processes on remote computers to exit. 只能查看远程计算机上运行的进程的信息。You can only view information for processes running on remote computers. ## Examples 下面的示例启动记事本的实例。The following example starts an instance of Notepad. 然后，它以2秒的间隔检索关联进程的物理内存使用率，最大值为10秒。It then retrieves the physical memory usage of the associated process at 2 second intervals for a maximum of 10 seconds. 该示例检测进程是否在10秒后退出。The example detects whether the process exits before 10 seconds have elapsed. 如果10秒后仍在运行，则此示例将关闭进程。The example closes the process if it is still running after 10 seconds. span.span: Note that the event is raised even if the value of is when the process exits during or before the user performs a check.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性建议在操作系统关闭进程时是否应通知组件。The property suggests whether the component should be notified when the operating system has shut down a process. 属性用于异步处理，以通知应用程序进程已退出。The property is used in asynchronous processing to notify your application that a process has exited. 若要强制您的应用程序以同步方式等待退出事件（这会中断应用程序的处理，直到发生退出事件），请使用 方法。To force your application to synchronously wait for an exit event (which interrupts processing of the application until the exit event has occurred), use the method. > [!NOTE] > 如果使用的是 Visual Studio 并双击项目中的 组件，将自动生成 事件委托和事件处理程序。If you're using Visual Studio and double-click a component in your project, an event delegate and event handler are automatically generated. 其他代码将 属性设置为 `false`。Additional code sets the property to `false`. 您必须将此属性更改为 `true`，以便事件处理程序在关联进程退出时执行。You must change this property to `true` for your event handler to execute when the associated process exits. 如果组件的 值为 `true`，或者当 `false` 并且组件调用了 检查时，该组件可以访问关联进程的管理信息，该信息仍由操作系统存储。If the component's value is `true`, or when is `false` and a check is invoked by the component, the component can access the administrative information for the associated process, which remains stored by the operating system. 此类信息包括 和 。Such information includes the and the . 关联进程退出后，该组件的 将不再指向现有进程资源。After the associated process exits, the of the component no longer points to an existing process resource. 相反，它只能用于访问有关进程资源的操作系统的信息。Instead, it can only be used to access the operating system's information about the process resource. 操作系统会注意到，存在已被 组件释放的退出进程的句柄，因此它会将 和 信息保留在内存中。The operating system is aware that there are handles to exited processes that haven't been released by components, so it keeps the and information in memory. 监视进程退出会产生相关费用。There's a cost associated with watching for a process to exit. 如果 `true`，则在关联进程终止时，将引发 事件。If is `true`, the event is raised when the associated process terminates. 此时将运行 事件的过程。Your procedures for the event run at that time. 有时，应用程序会启动进程，但不需要通知结束。Sometimes, your application starts a process but doesn't require notification of its closure. 例如，你的应用程序可以启动记事本，以允许用户执行文本编辑，但不会再进一步使用记事本应用程序。For example, your application can start Notepad to allow the user to perform text editing but make no further use of the Notepad application. 你可以选择在进程退出时避免通知，因为它与你的应用程序的继续操作无关。You can choose to avoid notification when the process exits because it's not relevant to the continued operation of your application. 将 设置为 `false` 可以保存系统资源。Setting to `false` can save system resources. ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建打印文件的进程。The following code example creates a process that prints a file. 它设置 属性，使进程在退出时引发 事件。It sets the property to cause the process to raise the event when it exits. 事件处理程序显示进程信息。The event handler displays process information. span.span: Occurs when an application writes to its redirected stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件指示关联进程已写入其重定向的 流。The event indicates that the associated process has written to its redirected stream. 此事件仅在 的异步读取操作过程中发生。The event only occurs during asynchronous read operations on . 若要启动异步读取操作，必须重定向 的 流，将事件处理程序添加到 事件，并调用 。To start asynchronous read operations, you must redirect the stream of a , add your event handler to the event, and call . 此后，每次进程将行写入重定向的 流时， 事件都会发出信号，直到进程退出或调用 。Thereafter, the event signals each time the process writes a line to the redirected stream, until the process exits or calls . > [!NOTE] > 处理异步输出的应用程序应调用 方法，以确保刷新了输出缓冲区。The application that is processing the asynchronous output should call the method to ensure that the output buffer has been flushed. 请注意，通过使用 重载来指定超时*不*会确保输出缓冲区已刷新。Note that specifying a timeout by using the overload does *not* ensure the output buffer has been flushed. ## Examples 以下示例使用 `net view` 命令列出远程计算机上可用的网络资源。The following example uses the `net view` command to list the available network resources on a remote computer. 用户以命令行参数的形式提供目标计算机名称。The user supplies the target computer name as a command-line argument. 用户还可以提供错误输出的文件名。The user can also supply a file name for error output. 该示例收集 net 命令的输出，等待进程完成，然后将输出结果写入控制台。The example collects the output of the net command, waits for the process to finish, and then writes the output results to the console. 如果用户提供了可选的错误文件，则该示例会将错误写入文件。If the user supplies the optional error file, the example writes errors to the file. summary.span: 获取关联进程终止时指定的值。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用 获取系统进程在退出时返回的状态。Use to get the status that the system process returned when it exited. 您可以使用退出代码，这与 `main()` 过程中的整数返回值非常类似。You can use the exit code much like an integer return value from a `main()` procedure. 进程的 值反映了该进程的应用程序开发人员实现的特定约定。The value for a process reflects the specific convention implemented by the application developer for that process. 如果使用退出代码值在代码中做出决策，请确保了解应用程序进程使用的退出代码约定。If you use the exit code value to make decisions in your code, be sure that you know the exit code convention used by the application process. 开发人员通常会指示 值为零的成功退出，并通过非零值指定错误，调用方法可以使用该值来识别异常进程终止的原因。Developers usually indicate a successful exit by an value of zero, and designate errors by nonzero values that the calling method can use to identify the cause of an abnormal process termination. 不需要遵循这些准则，但它们是约定。It is not necessary to follow these guidelines, but they are the convention. 如果尝试在进程退出之前获取 ，尝试会引发异常。If you try to get the before the process has exited, the attempt throws an exception. 首先检查 属性以验证关联的进程是否已终止。Examine the property first to verify whether the associated process has terminated. > [!NOTE] > 将标准输出重定向到异步事件处理程序后，在 返回 `true`时，输出处理可能不会完成。When standard output has been redirected to asynchronous event handlers, it is possible that output processing will not have completed when returns `true`. 若要确保异步事件处理已完成，请在检查 之前调用不带任何参数的 重载。To ensure that asynchronous event handling has been completed, call the overload that takes no parameter before checking . 您可以使用 或 方法来使关联进程退出。You can use the or the method to cause an associated process to exit. 关联进程退出时，有两种通知方式：同步和异步。There are two ways of being notified when the associated process exits: synchronously and asynchronously. 同步通知依赖于调用 方法来暂停应用程序的处理，直到关联的组件退出。Synchronous notification relies on calling the method to pause the processing of your application until the associated component exits. 异步通知依赖于 事件。Asynchronous notification relies on the event. 使用异步通知时，必须将 设置为 `true`，才能让 组件收到进程已退出的通知。When using asynchronous notification, must be set to `true` for the component to receive notification that the process has exited. ## Examples 下面的示例启动记事本的实例。The following example starts an instance of Notepad. 然后，该示例检索并显示关联进程的各种属性。The example then retrieves and displays various properties of the associated process. 该示例在进程退出时进行检测，并显示该进程的退出代码。The example detects when the process exits, and displays the process's exit code. [!code-cpp[Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64/VB/source.vb#1)]

summary.span: 在进程退出时发生。

span.span: Occurs when a process exits.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件指示关联进程已退出。The event indicates that the associated process exited. 此事件表示进程已终止（中止）或已成功关闭。This occurrence means either that the process terminated (aborted) or successfully closed. 仅当 `true` 属性的值时，才会发生此事件。This event can occur only if the value of the property is `true`. 关联进程退出时，有两种通知方式：同步和异步。There are two ways of being notified when the associated process exits: synchronously and asynchronously. 同步通知意味着调用 方法阻止当前线程，直到进程退出。Synchronous notification means calling the method to block the current thread until the process exits. 异步通知使用 事件，该事件允许调用线程同时继续执行。Asynchronous notification uses the event, which allows the calling thread to continue execution in the meantime. 在后一种情况下， 必须设置为 `true` 以便调用应用程序接收退出的事件。In the latter case, must be set to `true` for the calling application to receive the Exited event. 当操作系统关闭进程时，它会通知所有其他进程已退出事件的已注册处理程序。When the operating system shuts down a process, it notifies all other processes that have registered handlers for the Exited event. 目前，可以使用刚刚退出的进程的句柄来访问某些属性（如 ），并 操作系统维护，直到它完全释放该句柄。At this time, the handle of the process that just exited can be used to access some properties such as and that the operating system maintains until it releases that handle completely. > [!NOTE] > 即使您具有已退出进程的句柄，也不能再次调用 来重新连接到同一进程。Even if you have a handle to an exited process, you cannot call again to reconnect to the same process. 调用 会自动释放关联的进程，并使用同一文件而不是全新的 连接到进程。Calling automatically releases the associated process and connects to a process with the same file but an entirely new . 有关在 Windows 窗体应用程序中使用 事件的详细信息，请参阅 属性。For more information about the use of the event in Windows Forms applications, see the property. ## Examples 下面的代码示例创建打印文件的进程。The following code example creates a process that prints a file. 此方法在进程退出时引发 事件，因为在创建进程时设置了 属性。It raises the event when the process exits because the property was set when the process was created. 事件处理程序显示进程信息。The event handler displays process information. remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此方法创建新的 组件，并将其与本地计算机上的进程资源关联。Use this method to create a new component and associate it with a process resource on the local computer. 进程资源必须已存在于计算机上，因为 不会创建系统资源，而是将资源与应用程序生成的 组件相关联。The process resource must already exist on the computer, because does not create a system resource, but rather associates a resource with an application-generated component. 只能为当前在计算机上运行的进程检索进程 。A process can be retrieved only for a process that is currently running on the computer. 进程终止后，如果向其传递的是过期标识符， 会引发异常。After the process terminates, throws an exception if you pass it an expired identifier. 在任何特定计算机上，进程的标识符都是唯一的。On any particular computer, the identifier of a process is unique. 最多返回一个进程。 returns one process at most. 如果要获取运行特定应用程序的所有进程，请使用 。If you want to get all the processes running a particular application, use . 如果运行指定应用程序的计算机上存在多个进程， 将返回包含所有关联进程的数组。If multiple processes exist on the computer running the specified application, returns an array containing all the associated processes. 你可以依次查询每个进程的标识符。You can query each of these processes in turn for its identifier. 可以在 Windows 任务管理器的 "`Processes`" 面板中查看进程标识符。The process identifier can be viewed in the `Processes` panel of the Windows Task Manager. "`PID`" 列显示分配给进程的进程标识符。The `PID` column displays the process identifier that is assigned to a process. `processId` 参数是一个 （32位有符号整数），尽管基础 Windows API 对类似的 Api 使用 `DWORD` （无符号32位整数）。The `processId` parameter is an (a 32-bit signed integer), although the underlying Windows API uses a `DWORD` (an unsigned 32-bit integer) for similar APIs. 这是出于历史原因。This is for historical reasons. ## Examples 下面的示例检索当前进程的信息、在本地计算机上运行的进程、在本地计算机上运行的所有 Notepad 实例，以及本地计算机上的特定进程。The following example retrieves information of the current process, processes running on the local computer, all instances of Notepad running on the local computer, and a specific process on the local computer. 然后，它将检索远程计算机上相同进程的信息。It then retrieves information for the same processes on a remote computer. "`PID`" 列显示分配给进程的进程标识符。The `PID` column displays the process identifier that is assigned to a process. 如果未指定 `machineName`，则使用本地计算机。If you do not specify a `machineName`, the local computer is used. 或者，您可以通过将 `machineName` 设置为值 "." 或空字符串（""）来指定本地计算机。Alternatively, you can specify the local computer by setting `machineName` to the value "." or to an empty string (""). `processId` 参数是一个 （32位有符号整数），尽管基础 Windows API 对类似的 Api 使用 `DWORD` （无符号32位整数）。The `processId` parameter is an (a 32-bit signed integer), although the underlying Windows API uses a `DWORD` (an unsigned 32-bit integer) for similar APIs. 这是出于历史原因。This is for historical reasons. ## Examples 下面的示例检索当前进程的信息、在本地计算机上运行的进程、在本地计算机上运行的所有 Notepad 实例，以及本地计算机上的特定进程。The following example retrieves information of the current process, processes running on the local computer, all instances of Notepad running on the local computer, and a specific process on the local computer. 然后，它将检索远程计算机上相同进程的信息。It then retrieves information for the same processes on a remote computer. remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此方法创建新的 组件的数组，并将它们与本地计算机上的所有进程资源关联。Use this method to create an array of new components and associate them with all the process resources on the local computer. 进程资源必须已存在于本地计算机上，因为 不会创建系统资源，而是将资源与应用程序生成的 组件相关联。The process resources must already exist on the local computer, because does not create system resources but rather associates resources with application-generated components. 由于操作系统本身正在运行后台进程，此数组绝不会为空。Because the operating system itself is running background processes, this array is never empty. 如果您不想检索计算机上运行的所有进程，则可以使用 或 方法来限制它们的数量。If you do not want to retrieve all the processes running on the computer, you can restrict their number by using the or method. 创建一个 组件，该组件通过传递给方法的进程标识符与系统上标识的进程相关联。 creates a component that is associated with the process identified on the system by the process identifier that you pass to the method. 创建一个 组件的数组，这些组件的关联进程资源共享你传递给方法的可执行文件。 creates an array of components whose associated process resources share the executable file you pass to the method. > [!NOTE] > 在服务主机进程（svchost.exe）的同一个实例中，可以加载多个 Windows 服务。Multiple Windows services can be loaded within the same instance of the Service Host process (svchost.exe). GetProcesses 不标识这些单独的服务;为此，请参阅 。GetProcesses does not identify those individual services; for that, see . ## Examples 下面的示例检索当前进程的信息、在本地计算机上运行的进程、在本地计算机上运行的所有 Notepad 实例，以及本地计算机上的特定进程。The following example retrieves information of the current process, processes running on the local computer, all instances of Notepad running on the local computer, and a specific process on the local computer. 然后，它将检索远程计算机上相同进程的信息。It then retrieves information for the same processes on a remote computer. summary.span: 创建新的 组件的数组，并将它们与本地计算机上共享指定的进程名称的所有进程资源关联。

span.span: Creates an array of new components and associates them with all the process resources on the local computer that share the specified process name.

returns.span: 类型 的数组，表示运行指定应用程序或文件的进程资源。

span.span: An array of type that represents the process resources running the specified application or file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用此方法创建新的 组件的数组，并将它们与本地计算机上运行相同可执行文件的所有进程资源关联。Use this method to create an array of new components and associate them with all the process resources that are running the same executable file on the local computer. 进程资源必须已存在于计算机上，因为 不会创建系统资源，而是将它们与应用程序生成的 组件相关联。The process resources must already exist on the computer, because does not create system resources but rather associates them with application-generated components. 可以为当前未在本地计算机上运行的可执行文件指定 `processName`，因此该方法返回的数组可能为空。A `processName` can be specified for an executable file that is not currently running on the local computer, so the array the method returns can be empty. 进程名称是进程（例如 Outlook）的友好名称，该名称不包括 .exe 扩展名或路径。The process name is a friendly name for the process, such as Outlook, that does not include the .exe extension or the path. 有助于获取和操作与相同可执行文件关联的所有进程。 is helpful for getting and manipulating all the processes that are associated with the same executable file. 例如，可以将可执行文件名作为 `processName` 参数传递，以便关闭该可执行文件的所有正在运行的实例。For example, you can pass an executable file name as the `processName` parameter, in order to shut down all the running instances of that executable file. 尽管进程 对于系统上的单个进程资源是唯一的，但本地计算机上的多个进程可以运行 `processName` 参数指定的应用程序。Although a process is unique to a single process resource on the system, multiple processes on the local computer can be running the application specified by the `processName` parameter. 因此， 最多返回一个进程，但 返回包含所有关联进程的数组。Therefore, returns one process at most, but returns an array containing all the associated processes. 如果需要使用标准 API 调用来操作进程，可以依次查询每个进程的标识符。If you need to manipulate the process using standard API calls, you can query each of these processes in turn for its identifier. 你不能只通过进程名称访问进程资源，但一旦检索到与进程资源关联的 组件数组，就可以启动、终止，并以其他方式处理系统资源。You cannot access process resources through the process name alone but, once you have retrieved an array of components that have been associated with the process resources, you can start, terminate, and otherwise manipulate the system resources. ## Examples 下面的示例检索当前进程的信息、在本地计算机上运行的进程、在本地计算机上运行的所有 Notepad 实例，以及本地计算机上的特定进程。The following example retrieves information of the current process, processes running on the local computer, all instances of Notepad running on the local computer, and a specific process on the local computer. 然后，它将检索远程计算机上相同进程的信息。It then retrieves information for the same processes on a remote computer. 对于系统上的单个进程资源是唯一的，但本地计算机上的多个进程可以运行 `processName` 参数指定的应用程序。Although a process is unique to a single process resource on the system, multiple processes on the local computer can be running the application specified by the `processName` parameter. 因此， 最多返回一个进程，但 返回包含所有关联进程的数组。Therefore, returns one process at most, but returns an array containing all the associated processes. 如果需要使用标准 API 调用来操作进程，可以依次查询每个进程的标识符。If you need to manipulate the process using standard API calls, you can query each of these processes in turn for its identifier. 你不能只通过进程名称访问进程资源，但一旦检索到与进程资源关联的 you can start, terminate, and otherwise manipulate the system resources. 您可以使用此重载获取本地计算机以及远程计算机上的进程。You can use this overload to get processes on the local computer as well as on a remote computer. 使用 "." 指定本地计算机。Use "." to specify the local computer. 默认情况下，存在使用本地计算机的另一个重载。Another overload exists that uses the local computer by default. 您可以访问远程计算机上的进程，以便查看有关进程的信息（例如统计信息）。You can access processes on remote computers only to view information, such as statistics, about the processes. 不能关闭、终止（使用 ）或启动远程计算机上的进程。You cannot close, terminate (using ), or start processes on remote computers. ## Examples remarks.format: ## Remarks 应用程序可以获取进程的句柄，该句柄可用作多个进程信息和控制函数的参数。An application can obtain a handle to a process that can be used as a parameter to many process-information and control functions. 您可以使用此句柄来初始化 或使用平台调用来调用本机方法。You can use this handle to initialize a or to call native methods with platform invoke. 此进程句柄专用于应用程序，换言之，无法共享进程句柄。This process handle is private to an application--in other words, process handles cannot be shared. 进程还具有一个与 不同的进程 ，因此它在整个系统中有效。A process also has a process which, unlike the , is unique and, therefore, valid throughout the system. 只有通过对的调用启动的进程 设置相应 实例的 属性。Only processes started through a call to set the property of the corresponding instances.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 句柄为进程提供了引用对象的方法。Handles provide a way for a process to refer to objects. 进程可以获取文件、资源、消息队列以及许多其他操作系统对象的句柄。A process can obtain handles to files, resources, message queues, and many other operating system objects. 仅当句柄计数为零时，操作系统才回收与进程关联的内存。The operating system reclaims the memory associated with the process only when the handle count is zero.

span.span: if the operating system process referenced by the component has terminated; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 的 `true` 值指示关联进程已终止（正常或异常）。A value of `true` for indicates that the associated process has terminated, either normally or abnormally. 可以通过调用 或 来请求或强制关联进程退出。You can request or force the associated process to exit by calling or . 如果句柄已打开到进程，则在进程退出后，操作系统将释放进程内存，但会保留有关进程的管理信息，例如句柄、退出代码和退出时间。If a handle is open to the process, the operating system releases the process memory when the process has exited, but retains administrative information about the process, such as the handle, exit code, and exit time. 若要获取此信息，可以使用 "" 和 "" 属性。To get this information, you can use the and properties. 对于此组件启动的进程，会自动填充这些属性。These properties are populated automatically for processes that were started by this component. 当所有与系统进程关联的 组件都被销毁并且不将更多的句柄保留到已退出的进程时，管理信息将被释放。The administrative information is released when all the components that are associated with the system process are destroyed and hold no more handles to the exited process. 进程可以独立于你的代码而终止。A process can terminate independently of your code. 如果使用此组件启动了进程，则系统会自动更新 的值，即使关联的进程独立退出也是如此。If you started the process using this component, the system updates the value of automatically, even if the associated process exits independently. > [!NOTE] > 将标准输出重定向到异步事件处理程序后，当此属性返回 `true`时，输出处理可能不会完成。When standard output has been redirected to asynchronous event handlers, it is possible that output processing will not have completed when this property returns `true`. 若要确保异步事件处理已完成，请在检查 之前调用不带任何参数的 重载。To ensure that asynchronous event handling has been completed, call the overload that takes no parameter before checking . ## Examples 下面的示例启动记事本的实例。The following example starts an instance of Notepad. 然后，它以2秒的间隔检索关联进程的物理内存使用率，最大值为10秒。It then retrieves the physical memory usage of the associated process at 2 second intervals for a maximum of 10 seconds. 该示例检测进程是否在10秒后退出。The example detects whether the process exits before 10 seconds have elapsed. 如果10秒后仍在运行，则此示例将关闭进程。The example closes the process if it is still running after 10 seconds. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果关联的进程未运行，则进程 无效。The process is not valid if the associated process is not running. 因此，在尝试检索 属性之前，应确保该进程正在运行。Therefore, you should ensure that the process is running before attempting to retrieve the property. 在进程终止之前，进程标识符唯一标识整个系统中的进程。Until the process terminates, the process identifier uniquely identifies the process throughout the system. 可以通过将进程标识符传递到 方法，将本地或远程计算机上运行的进程连接到新的 实例。You can connect a process that is running on a local or remote computer to a new instance by passing the process identifier to the method. 是一种 `static` 方法，该方法创建新的组件，并自动为新的 实例设置 属性。 is a `static` method that creates a new component and sets the property for the new instance automatically. 系统可以重新使用进程标识符。Process identifiers can be reused by the system. 仅当关联的进程正在运行时， 属性值才是唯一的。The property value is unique only while the associated process is running. 进程终止后，系统可以为不相关的进程重用 属性值。After the process has terminated, the system can reuse the property value for an unrelated process. 由于标识符在系统中是唯一的，因此你可以将其作为传递 实例的替代方法传递给其他线程。Because the identifier is unique on the system, you can pass it to other threads as an alternative to passing a instance. 此操作可以保存系统资源，并保证正确地标识该进程。This action can save system resources yet guarantee that the process is correctly identified. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何获取应用程序的所有正在运行的实例的 。The following example demonstrates how to obtain the for all running instances of an application. 该代码将创建一个新的记事本实例，列出记事本的所有实例，然后允许用户输入 号以删除特定的实例。The code creates a new instance of Notepad, lists all the instances of Notepad, and then allows the user to enter the number to remove a specific instance. remarks.format: ## Remarks `Kill` 方法强制终止进程，而 只请求终止。The `Kill` method forces a termination of the process, while only requests a termination. 当执行具有图形界面的进程时，其消息循环处于等待状态。When a process with a graphical interface is executing, its message loop is in a wait state. 每次操作系统将 Windows 消息发送到该进程时，消息循环都会执行。The message loop executes every time a Windows message is sent to the process by the operating system. 调用 将发送一个请求来关闭主窗口，该窗口在格式正确的应用程序中将关闭子窗口，并为应用程序撤消所有正在运行的消息循环。Calling sends a request to close the main window, which, in a well-formed application, closes child windows and revokes all running message loops for the application. 通过调用 退出进程的请求不会强制应用程序退出。The request to exit the process by calling does not force the application to quit. 应用程序可以在退出前要求用户进行验证，也可以拒绝退出。The application can ask for user verification before quitting, or it can refuse to quit. 若要强制退出应用程序，请使用 `Kill` 方法。To force the application to quit, use the `Kill` method. 的行为与用户使用系统菜单关闭应用程序的主窗口的行为相同。The behavior of is identical to that of a user closing an application's main window using the system menu. 因此，通过关闭主窗口来退出进程的请求不会强制立即退出。Therefore, the request to exit the process by closing the main window does not force the application to quit immediately. > [!NOTE] > 方法以异步方式执行。The method executes asynchronously. 调用 `Kill` 方法后，调用 方法以等待进程退出，或检查 属性以确定进程是否已退出。After calling the `Kill` method, call the method to wait for the process to exit, or check the property to determine if the process has exited. > [!NOTE] > 方法和 属性不反映后代进程的状态。The method and the property do not reflect the status of descendant processes. > 使用 `Kill(entireProcessTree: true)` 时， 和 将指示在给定进程退出后退出已完成，即使所有子代尚未退出也是如此。When `Kill(entireProcessTree: true)` is used, and will indicate that exiting has completed after the given process exits, even if all descendants have not yet exited. 如果调用 `Kill`，则进程编辑的数据或分配给进程的资源可能会丢失。Data edited by the process or resources allocated to the process can be lost if you call `Kill`. `Kill` 会导致异常进程终止，只应在必要时使用。`Kill` causes an abnormal process termination and should be used only when necessary. 可以有序终止进程，并关闭所有窗口，因此更适合使用接口的应用程序。 enables an orderly termination of the process and closes all windows, so it is preferable for applications with an interface. 如果 失败，则可以使用 `Kill` 终止进程。If fails, you can use `Kill` to terminate the process. `Kill` 是终止没有图形界面的进程的唯一方法。`Kill` is the only way to terminate processes that do not have graphical interfaces. 只能对在本地计算机上运行的进程调用 `Kill` 和 。You can call `Kill` and only for processes that are running on the local computer. 不能使远程计算机上的进程退出。You cannot cause processes on remote computers to exit. 只能查看远程计算机上运行的进程的信息。You can only view information for processes running on remote computers. > [!NOTE] > 如果在进程当前正在终止时对 `Kill` 方法的调用，则会引发 ，拒绝访问。If the call to the `Kill` method is made while the process is currently terminating, a is thrown for Access Denied.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Diagnostics.MonitoringDescription("The handle of the main window of the process.")

summary.span: 获取关联进程主窗口的窗口句柄。

span.span: Gets the window handle of the main window of the associated process.

value.span: 关联进程主窗口的系统生成的窗口句柄。

span.span: The system-generated window handle of the main window of the associated process.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 主窗口是由当前具有焦点的进程打开的窗口（ 窗体）。The main window is the window opened by the process that currently has the focus (the form). 如果已更改，则必须使用 方法刷新 对象以获取当前的主窗口句柄。You must use the method to refresh the object to get the current main window handle if it has changed. 通常情况下，因为窗口句柄已缓存，所以请事先使用 以保证检索当前句柄。In general, because the window handle is cached, use beforehand to guarantee that you'll retrieve the current handle. 只能获取本地计算机上运行的进程的 属性。You can get the property only for processes that are running on the local computer. 属性是唯一标识与进程关联的窗口的值。The property is a value that uniquely identifies the window that is associated with the process. 仅当进程具有图形界面时，才有一个与之关联的主窗口。A process has a main window associated with it only if the process has a graphical interface. 如果关联进程没有主窗口，则 值为零。If the associated process does not have a main window, the value is zero. 对于已隐藏的进程（即，任务栏中不显示的进程），值也为零。The value is also zero for processes that have been hidden, that is, processes that are not visible in the taskbar. 这种情况可能会出现在通知区域中任务栏最右侧的图标。This can be the case for processes that appear as icons in the notification area, at the far right of the taskbar. 如果刚启动了一个进程，并想要使用其主窗口句柄，请考虑使用 方法来允许该进程开始，确保已创建了主窗口句柄。If you have just started a process and want to use its main window handle, consider using the method to allow the process to finish starting, ensuring that the main window handle has been created. 否则，将引发异常。Otherwise, an exception will be thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property IntPtr MaxWorkingSet { IntPtr get(); void set(IntPtr value); };
member this.MaxWorkingSet : nativeint with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Diagnostics.MonitoringDescription("The maximum amount of physical memory the process has required since it was started.")

summary.span: 获取或设置关联进程允许的最大工作集大小（以字节为单位）。

span.span: Gets or sets the maximum allowable working set size, in bytes, for the associated process.

value.span: 内存中允许的进程的最大工作集大小（以字节为单位）。

span.span: The maximum working set size that is allowed in memory for the process, in bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 进程的工作集是当前对物理 RAM 内存中的进程可见的内存页集。The working set of a process is the set of memory pages currently visible to the process in physical RAM memory. 这些页是常驻的，可供应用程序使用，而不会触发页面错误。These pages are resident and available for an application to use without triggering a page fault. 工作集包括共享数据和私人数据。The working set includes both shared and private data. 共享数据包括包含应用程序执行的所有说明的页面，包括 .dll 文件中的页面和系统 .dll 文件。The shared data includes the pages that contain all the instructions that your application executes, including the pages in your .dll files and the system.dll files. 随着工作集大小的增加，内存需求也会增加。As the working set size increases, memory demand increases. 进程具有最小和最大工作集大小。A process has minimum and maximum working set sizes. 每次创建进程资源时，系统会保留相当于进程的最小工作集大小的内存量。Each time a process resource is created, the system reserves an amount of memory equal to the minimum working set size for the process. 当进程处于活动状态时，虚拟内存管理器将尝试至少保留最少的内存，但不会超过最大大小。The virtual memory manager attempts to keep at least the minimum amount of memory resident when the process is active, but it never keeps more than the maximum size. 系统设置默认的工作集大小。The system sets the default working set sizes. 您可以使用 和 成员修改这些大小。You can modify these sizes using the and members. 但是，设置这些值不能保证保留或驻留内存。However, setting these values does not guarantee that the memory will be reserved or resident. > [!NOTE] > 增大进程的工作集大小时，会从系统的其余部分中取出物理内存。When you increase the working set size of a process, you take physical memory away from the rest of the system. 请确保未请求的最小或最大工作集大小太大，因为这样做可能会降低系统性能。Ensure that you do not request a minimum or maximum working set size that is too large, because doing so can degrade system performance.

exception.span: 最大的工作集大小无效。

span.span: The maximum working set size is invalid.

exception.span: 它必须大于或等于最小的工作集大小。

span.span: It must be greater than or equal to the minimum working set size.

exception.span: 无法从关联的进程资源中检索工作集信息。

span.span: Working set information cannot be retrieved from the associated process resource.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 进程模块表示加载到特定进程中的 .dll 或 .exe 文件。A process module represents a.dll or .exe file that is loaded into a particular process. 实例使你可以查看模块的相关信息，包括模块名称、文件名和模块内存详细信息。A instance lets you view information about a module, including the module name, file name, and module memory details. 进程可以将多个模块加载到内存中。A process can load multiple modules into memory. 例如，加载其他 .dll 文件的 .exe 文件具有多个模块。For example,.exe files that load additional .dll files have multiple modules. 启动进程后，在系统加载进程之前，此集合为空。After starting the process, this collection is empty until the system has loaded the process. 如果该进程具有主窗口，您可以在检索此属性之前调用 ，以确保获取该列表时该集合是非空的。If the process has a main window, you can call before retrieving this property to ensure that the collection is nonempty when you get the list.

summary.span: 获取为关联的进程分配的非分页系统内存量（以字节为单位）。

span.span: Gets the amount of nonpaged system memory, in bytes, allocated for the associated process.

value.span: 为关联的进程分配的、不能写入虚拟内存分页文件中的系统内存量（以字节为单位）。

span.span: The amount of system memory, in bytes, allocated for the associated process that cannot be written to the virtual memory paging file.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性返回的值表示进程使用的非分页系统内存的当前大小（以字节为单位）。The value returned by this property represents the current size of nonpaged system memory used by the process, in bytes. 系统内存是操作系统使用的物理内存，分为分页和非分页的池。System memory is the physical memory used by the operating system, and is divided into paged and nonpaged pools. 非分页的内存分配将保留在系统内存中，并且不会分页到虚拟内存分页文件中。Nonpaged memory allocations remain in system memory and are not paged out to the virtual memory paging file. 此属性可用于监视包含32位处理器或64位处理器的计算机上的内存使用情况。This property can be used to monitor memory usage on computers with 32-bit processors or 64-bit processors. 属性值等效于进程的 "**池非分页字节数**" 性能计数器。The property value is equivalent to the **Pool Nonpaged Bytes** performance counter for the process. ## Examples 下面的代码示例启动记事本应用程序的实例。The following code example starts an instance of the Notepad application. 然后，该示例检索并显示关联进程的各种属性。The example then retrieves and displays various properties of the associated process. 该示例在进程退出时进行检测，并显示其退出代码和高峰内存统计信息。The example detects when the process exits, and displays its exit code and peak memory statistics. summary.span: 引发 事件。

span.span: Raises the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是引发 事件的 API 方法。 is the API method that raises the event. 调用 会导致 事件发生，并且是使用 组件引发事件的唯一方法。Calling causes the event to occur and is the only way to raise the event using the component. 主要在从组件派生类时使用。 is primarily used when deriving classes from the component. 作为 的替代方法，可以编写自己的事件处理程序。As an alternative to , you can write your own event handler. 创建自己的事件处理程序委托和自己的事件处理方法。You create your own event handler delegate and your own event-handling method. > [!NOTE] > 如果你使用的是 Visual Studio 环境，则在将 组件拖到窗体上并双击该图标时，将为你创建事件处理程序委托（AddOnExited）和事件处理方法（Process1_Exited）。If you are using the Visual Studio environment, an event handler delegate (AddOnExited) and an event-handling method (Process1_Exited) are created for you when you drag a component onto a form and double-click the icon. 当 事件发生时，你创建的代码将输入到 Process1_Exited 过程中。The code you create to run when the event occurs is entered into the Process1_Exited procedure. 您无需创建 成员，因为它是为您实现的。You do not need to create the member, because it is implemented for you. 引发事件时，将通过委托调用事件处理程序。Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. 有关概述，请参阅[处理和引发事件](~/docs/standard/events/index.md)。For an overview, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md). ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何在派生类中使用 方法。The following example shows how to use the method in a derived class. summary.span: 每次应用程序向其重定向 流中写入行时发生。

span.span: Occurs each time an application writes a line to its redirected stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件指示关联的 已写入一个行，并以换行符结尾，并将其重定向 流中。The event indicates that the associated has written a line, terminating with a newline character, to its redirected stream. 上的异步读取操作期间，会启用该事件。The event is enabled during asynchronous read operations on . 若要启动异步读取操作，必须重定向 的 流，将事件处理程序添加到 事件，并调用 。To start asynchronous read operations, you must redirect the stream of a , add your event handler to the event, and call . 此后，每次进程将行写入重定向的 流时， 事件都会发出信号，直到进程退出或调用 。Thereafter, the event signals each time the process writes a line to the redirected stream, until the process exits or calls . > [!NOTE] > 处理异步输出的应用程序应调用 方法，以确保刷新了输出缓冲区。The application that is processing the asynchronous output should call the method to ensure that the output buffer has been flushed. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何对 `ipconfig` 命令的重定向 流执行异步读取操作。The following example illustrates how to perform asynchronous read operations on the redirected stream of the `ipconfig` command. 该示例创建 `OutputHandler` 事件处理程序的事件委托，并将其与 事件关联。The example creates an event delegate for the `OutputHandler` event handler and associates it with the event. 该事件处理程序从重定向的 流接收文本行，设置文本的格式，并将其保存到稍后显示在此示例控制台窗口中的输出字符串。The event handler receives text lines from the redirected stream, formats the text, and saves it in an output string that's later shown in the example's console window. span.span: The amount of memory, in bytes, allocated in the virtual memory paging file for the associated process.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性返回的值表示进程使用的虚拟内存分页文件中的当前内存大小（以字节为单位）。The value returned by this property represents the current size of memory in the virtual memory paging file used by the process, in bytes. 操作系统将虚拟内存分页文件与物理内存一起使用，以管理每个进程的虚拟地址空间。The operating system uses the virtual memory paging file in conjunction with physical memory to manage the virtual address space for each process. 当不可分页内存未使用时，可以将其传输到磁盘上的虚拟内存分页文件中。When pageable memory is not in use, it can be transferred to the virtual memory paging file on disk. 若要获取由操作系统用于进程的内存大小，请使用 属性。To obtain the size of memory used by the operating system for the process, use the property. 此属性可用于监视包含32位处理器或64位处理器的计算机上的内存使用情况。This property can be used to monitor memory usage on computers with 32-bit processors or 64-bit processors. 属性值等效于进程的**Page File Bytes**性能计数器。The property value is equivalent to the **Page File Bytes** performance counter for the process. ## Examples 下面的代码示例启动记事本应用程序的实例，然后检索并显示关联进程的各种属性。The following code example starts an instance of the Notepad application, and then retrieves and displays various properties of the associated process. 该示例在进程退出时进行检测，并显示其退出代码和高峰内存统计信息。The example detects when the process exits, and displays its exit code and peak memory statistics. summary.span: 获取关联进程的峰值工作集大小（以字节为单位）。

span.span: Gets the peak working set size for the associated process, in bytes.

value.span: 关联进程一次所需的最大物理内存量（以字节为单位）。

span.span: The maximum amount of physical memory that the associated process has required all at once, in bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 进程的工作集是当前对物理 RAM 内存中的进程可见的内存页集。The working set of a process is the set of memory pages currently visible to the process in physical RAM memory. 这些页是常驻的，可供应用程序使用，而不会触发页面错误。These pages are resident and available for an application to use without triggering a page fault. 工作集包括共享数据和私人数据。The working set includes both shared and private data. 共享数据包括包含进程执行的所有说明的页面，包括进程模块和系统库。The shared data includes the pages that contain all the instructions that the process executes, including process modules and the system libraries.

summary.span: 获取关联进程使用的最大物理内存量（以字节为单位）。

span.span: Gets the maximum amount of physical memory, in bytes, used by the associated process.

value.span: 从启动关联进程以来为关联进程分配的最大物理内存量（以字节为单位）。

span.span: The maximum amount of physical memory, in bytes, allocated for the associated process since it was started.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性返回的值表示进程自启动以来使用的工作集内存的最大大小（以字节为单位）。The value returned by this property represents the maximum size of working set memory used by the process since it started, in bytes. 进程的工作集是当前对物理 RAM 内存中的进程可见的内存页集。The working set of a process is the set of memory pages currently visible to the process in physical RAM memory. 这些页是常驻的，可供应用程序使用，而不会触发页面错误。These pages are resident and available for an application to use without triggering a page fault. 工作集包括共享数据和私人数据。The working set includes both shared and private data. 共享数据包括包含进程所执行的所有指令的页面，包括进程模块和系统库中的说明。The shared data includes the pages that contain all the instructions that the process executes, including instructions from the process modules and the system libraries. 此属性可用于监视包含32位处理器或64位处理器的计算机上的内存使用情况。This property can be used to monitor memory usage on computers with 32-bit processors or 64-bit processors. 属性值等效于进程的 "**工作集峰值**" 性能计数器。The property value is equivalent to the **Working Set Peak** performance counter for the process. ## Examples 下面的代码示例启动记事本应用程序的实例。The following code example starts an instance of the Notepad application. 然后，该示例检索并显示关联进程的各种属性。The example then retrieves and displays various properties of the associated process. 该示例在进程退出时进行检测，并显示其退出代码和高峰内存统计信息。The example detects when the process exits, and displays its exit code and peak memory statistics. summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示主窗口拥有焦点时是否应由操作系统暂时提升关联进程优先级。

span.span: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the associated process priority should temporarily be boosted by the operating system when the main window has the focus.

value.span: 如果进程离开等待状态时应动态提升进程优先级别，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if dynamic boosting of the process priority should take place for a process when it is taken out of the wait state; otherwise, .

value.span: 默认值为 。

span.span: The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当某个线程在优先级类具有一个或多个动态优先级枚举值（、或 ）的进程中运行时，系统会在该线程退出等待状态时暂时提升该线程的优先级。When a thread runs in a process for which the priority class has one of the dynamic priority enumeration values (, , or ), the system temporarily boosts the thread's priority when it is taken out of a wait state. 此操作可防止其他进程中断当前线程的处理。This action prevents other processes from interrupting the processing of the current thread. "" 设置会影响所有现有线程以及此进程随后创建的所有线程。The setting affects all the existing threads and any threads subsequently created by the process. 若要还原正常行为，请将 属性设置为 `false`。To restore normal behavior, set the property to `false`. > [!NOTE] > 提升优先级过高可能会耗尽基本操作系统和网络功能的资源，导致其他操作系统任务出现问题。Boosting the priority too high can drain resources from essential operating system and network functions, causing problems with other operating system tasks.

summary.span: 获取或设置关联进程的总体优先级类别。

span.span: Gets or sets the overall priority category for the associated process.

value.span: 关联进程的优先级类别，可从该类别计算进程的 。

span.span: The priority category for the associated process, from which the of the process is calculated.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 进程优先级类包含一系列线程优先级别。A process priority class encompasses a range of thread priority levels. 进程中运行的具有不同优先级的线程相对于进程的优先级类运行。Threads with different priorities that are running in the process run relative to the priority class of the process. Win32 使用四个优先级类，每个类具有7个基本优先级别。Win32 uses four priority classes with seven base priority levels per class. 这些进程优先级类在 枚举中捕获，这使你可以将进程优先级设置为 、、、、或 。These process priority classes are captured in the enumeration, which lets you set the process priority to , , , , , or . 根据所用的时间或其他提升，操作系统在需要将进程移到其他进程以访问处理器时，可以更改基本优先级级别。Based on the time elapsed or other boosts, the base priority level can be changed by the operating system when a process needs to be put ahead of others for access to the processor. 此外，还可以设置 ，以暂时提升从等待状态中获取的线程的优先级。In addition, you can set the to temporarily boost the priority level of threads that have been taken out of the wait state. 当进程返回到等待状态时，将重置此优先级。The priority is reset when the process returns to the wait state. 利用 属性，您可以查看分配给进程的启动优先级。The property lets you view the starting priority that is assigned to a process. 但是，因为它是只读的，所以不能使用 属性设置进程的优先级。However, because it is read-only, you cannot use the property to set the priority of a process. 若要更改优先级，请使用 属性，该属性可获取或设置进程的总体优先级类别。To change the priority, use the property, which gets or sets the overall priority category for the process. 无法使用系统监视器查看优先级类。The priority class cannot be viewed using System Monitor. 下表显示 和 值之间的关系。The following table shows the relationship between the and values. |BasePriorityBasePriority|PriorityClassPriorityClass| |------------------|-------------------| |44|| |88|| |1313|| |2424|| ## Examples 下面的示例启动记事本的实例。The following example starts an instance of Notepad. 然后，该示例检索并显示关联进程的各种属性。The example then retrieves and displays various properties of the associated process. 该示例在进程退出时进行检测，并显示该进程的退出代码。The example detects when the process exits, and displays the process's exit code. summary.span: 获取该进程的名称。

span.span: Gets the name of the process.

value.span: 系统用以向用户标识该进程的名称。

span.span: The name that the system uses to identify the process to the user.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性保留一个可执行文件名（如 Outlook），该名称不包括 .exe 扩展名或路径。The property holds an executable file name, such as Outlook, that does not include the .exe extension or the path. 它有助于获取和操作与同一可执行文件关联的所有进程。It is helpful for getting and manipulating all the processes that are associated with the same executable file. > [!NOTE] > 在 [!INCLUDE[Win2kFamily](~/includes/win2kfamily-md.md)] 操作系统上，如果无法获取进程模块信息，则 属性可能会被截断为15个字符。On [!INCLUDE[Win2kFamily](~/includes/win2kfamily-md.md)] operating systems, the property may be truncated to 15 characters if the process module information cannot be obtained. 可以调用 ，并向其传递可执行文件的名称，以检索包含指定计算机上每个正在运行的实例的数组。You can call , passing it an executable file name, to retrieve an array that contains every running instance on the specified computer. 例如，你可以使用此数组关闭可执行文件的所有正在运行的实例。You can use this array, for example, to shut down all the running instances of the executable file.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Diagnostics.MonitoringDescription("Allowed processor that can be used by this process.")

summary.span: 获取或设置一些处理器，此进程中的线程可以按计划在这些处理器上运行。

span.span: Gets or sets the processors on which the threads in this process can be scheduled to run.

value.span: 位掩码，表示关联进程内的线程可以在其上运行的处理器。

span.span: A bitmask representing the processors that the threads in the associated process can run on.

value.span: 默认值取决于计算机上的处理器数。

span.span: The default depends on the number of processors on the computer.

value.span: 默认值为 2 n -1，其中 n 是处理器数。

span.span: The default value is 2 n -1, where n is the number of processors.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在 Windows 2000 和更高版本中，进程中的线程可以从处理器迁移到处理器，每次迁移都重新加载处理器缓存。In Windows 2000 and later, a thread in a process can migrate from processor to processor, with each migration reloading the processor cache. 在负载过重的系统负载下，通过减少重新加载处理器缓存的次数来指定哪个处理器应运行特定的线程，从而提高性能。Under heavy system loads, specifying which processor should run a specific thread can improve performance by reducing the number of times the processor cache is reloaded. 处理器和线程之间的关联称为处理器关联。The association between a processor and a thread is called the processor affinity. 每个处理器都表示为一个位。Each processor is represented as a bit. 位0为 processor one，位1为 processor 2，依此类推。Bit 0 is processor one, bit 1 is processor two, and so forth. 如果将某个位设置为值1，则会为线程分配选择相应的处理器。If you set a bit to the value 1, the corresponding processor is selected for thread assignment. 将 值设置为零时，操作系统的计划算法会设置线程的关联。When you set the value to zero, the operating system's scheduling algorithms set the thread's affinity. 如果将 值设置为任何非零值，则该值将解释为指定可供选择的处理器的位掩码。When the value is set to any nonzero value, the value is interpreted as a bitmask that specifies those processors eligible for selection. 下表显示了对八处理器系统的 值的选择。The following table shows a selection of values for an eight-processor system. |位Bitmask|二进制值Binary value|合格处理器Eligible processors| |-------------|------------------|-------------------------| |0x00010x0001|00000000 0000000100000000 00000001|11| |0x00030x0003|00000000 0000001100000000 00000011|1和21 and 2| |0x00070x0007|00000000 0000011100000000 00000111|1、2和31, 2 and 3| |0x00090x0009|00000000 0000100100000000 00001001|1和41 and 4| |0x007F0x007F|00000000 0111111100000000 01111111|1、2、3、4、5、6和71, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7|

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Refresh() cil managed

summary.span: 放弃已缓存到进程组件的关联仅存的任何相关信息。

span.span: Discards any information about the associated process that has been cached inside the process component.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用 后，有关每个属性的信息的第一个请求将导致进程组件从关联进程获取新值。After is called, the first request for information about each property causes the process component to obtain a new value from the associated process. 当 组件与某个进程资源关联时，将根据关联进程的状态立即填充 的属性值。When a component is associated with a process resource, the property values of the are immediately populated according to the status of the associated process. 如果有关关联进程的信息随后发生更改，则这些更改不会反映在 组件的缓存值中。If the information about the associated process subsequently changes, those changes are not reflected in the component's cached values. 组件是进程资源关联时的快照。The component is a snapshot of the process resource at the time they are associated. 若要查看关联进程的当前值，请调用 方法。To view the current values for the associated process, call the method. ## Examples 下面的示例启动记事本的实例。The following example starts an instance of Notepad. 然后，它以2秒的间隔检索关联进程的物理内存使用率，最大值为10秒。It then retrieves the physical memory usage of the associated process at 2 second intervals for a maximum of 10 seconds. 该示例检测进程是否在10秒后退出。The example detects whether the process exits before 10 seconds have elapsed. 如果10秒后仍在运行，则此示例将关闭进程。The example closes the process if it is still running after 10 seconds. [!code-cpp[process_refresh#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/process_refresh/CPP/process_refresh.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[process_refresh#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/process_refresh/CS/process_refresh.cs#1)] [!code-vb[process_refresh#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/process_refresh/VB/process_refresh.vb#1)]

summary.span: 获取指示进程的用户界面当前是否响应的值。

span.span: Gets a value indicating whether the user interface of the process is responding.

value.span: 如果关联进程的用户界面当前响应系统，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the user interface of the associated process is responding to the system; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果某个进程具有用户界面，则 属性将与用户界面联系，以确定该进程是否正在响应用户输入。If a process has a user interface, the property contacts the user interface to determine whether the process is responding to user input. 如果接口未立即响应，则 属性将返回 `false`。If the interface does not respond immediately, the property returns `false`. 使用此属性来确定关联进程的接口是否已停止响应。Use this property to determine whether the interface of the associated process has stopped responding. 如果该进程没有 ，则此属性将返回 `true`。If the process does not have a , this property returns `true`. ## Examples 下面的示例启动记事本的实例。The following example starts an instance of Notepad. 然后，该示例检索并显示关联进程的各种属性。The example then retrieves and displays various properties of the associated process. 该示例在进程退出时进行检测，并显示该进程的退出代码。The example detects when the process exits, and displays the process's exit code. [!code-cpp[Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Diag_Process_MemoryProperties64/VB/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property StandardError As StreamReader
public: property System::IO::StreamReader ^ StandardError { System::IO::StreamReader ^ get(); };

summary.span: 获取用于读取应用程序错误输出的流。

span.span: Gets a stream used to read the error output of the application.

value.span: 可用于读取应用程序的标准错误流的 。

span.span: A that can be used to read the standard error stream of the application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当 向其标准错误流写入文本时，该文本通常会显示在控制台上。When a writes text to its standard error stream, that text is normally displayed on the console. 通过重定向 流，你可以操作或取消进程的错误输出。By redirecting the stream, you can manipulate or suppress the error output of a process. 例如，你可以筛选文本，以不同的方式对其进行格式设置，或者将输出写入控制台和指定的日志文件。For example, you can filter the text, format it differently, or write the output to both the console and a designated log file. > [!NOTE] > 若要使用 ，你必须将 设置为 `false`，并且必须将 设置为 `true`。To use , you must set to `false`, and you must set to `true`. 否则，从 流中读取会引发异常。Otherwise, reading from the stream throws an exception. 重定向的 流可以同步或异步读取。The redirected stream can be read synchronously or asynchronously. 、和 等方法执行进程的错误输出流上的同步读取操作。Methods such as , , and perform synchronous read operations on the error output stream of the process. 在关联的 写入其 流或关闭流之前，这些同步读取操作不会完成。These synchronous read operations do not complete until the associated writes to its stream, or closes the stream. 与此相反， 会对 流启动异步读取操作。In contrast, starts asynchronous read operations on the stream. 此方法将为流输出启用指定的事件处理程序，并立即返回到调用方，当流输出定向到事件处理程序时，该处理程序可以执行其他操作。This method enables a designated event handler for the stream output and immediately returns to the caller, which can perform other work while the stream output is directed to the event handler. 同步读取操作会在调用方之间引入依赖关系，从 流读取，子进程写入该流。Synchronous read operations introduce a dependency between the caller reading from the stream and the child process writing to that stream. 这些依赖项可能会导致死锁情况。These dependencies can result in deadlock conditions. 当调用方从子进程的重定向流中进行读取时，它依赖于子进程。When the caller reads from the redirected stream of a child process, it is dependent on the child. 调用方等待读取操作，直到子级写入流或关闭流为止。The caller waits on the read operation until the child writes to the stream or closes the stream. 当子进程写入足够的数据以填充其重定向流时，它依赖于父进程。When the child process writes enough data to fill its redirected stream, it is dependent on the parent. 子进程将在下一次写入操作之前等待，直到父进程从整个流中读取或关闭流为止。The child process waits on the next write operation until the parent reads from the full stream or closes the stream. 当调用方和子进程等待彼此完成操作时，会发生死锁条件，并且这两个情况都无法继续。The deadlock condition results when the caller and child process wait on each other to complete an operation, and neither can proceed. 您可以通过计算调用方和子进程之间的依赖关系来避免死锁。You can avoid deadlocks by evaluating dependencies between the caller and child process. 本节中的最后两个示例使用 方法来启动一个名为*Write500Lines*的可执行文件。The last two examples in this section use the method to launch an executable named *Write500Lines.exe*. 下面的示例包含它的源代码。The following example contains its source code. [!code-csharp[Executable launched by Process.Start](~/samples/snippets/csharp/api/system.diagnostics/process/standardoutput/write500lines.cs)] [!code-vb[Executable launched by Process.Start](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/api/system.diagnostics/process/standardoutput/write500lines.vb)] 下面的示例演示如何从重定向的错误流中读取并等待子进程退出。The following example shows how to read from a redirected error stream and wait for the child process to exit. 它通过在 `p.WaitForExit`之前调用 `p.StandardError.ReadToEnd` 来避免死锁情况。It avoids a deadlock condition by calling `p.StandardError.ReadToEnd` before `p.WaitForExit`. 如果父进程在 `p.StandardError.ReadToEnd` 之前调用了 `p.WaitForExit`，并且子进程写入足够多的文本以填充重定向的流，则会导致死锁情况。A deadlock condition can result if the parent process calls `p.WaitForExit` before `p.StandardError.ReadToEnd` and the child process writes enough text to fill the redirected stream. 父进程会无限期地等待子进程退出。The parent process would wait indefinitely for the child process to exit. 子进程会无限期地等待父进程从完整的 流中读取。The child process would wait indefinitely for the parent to read from the full stream. [!code-csharp[Reading from the error stream](~/samples/snippets/csharp/api/system.diagnostics/process/standarderror/stderror-sync.cs)] [!code-vb[Reading from the error stream](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/api/system.diagnostics/process/standarderror/stderror-sync.vb)] 从标准输出和标准错误流中读取所有文本时，会出现类似的问题。There is a similar issue when you read all text from both the standard output and standard error streams. 下面的示例对两个流执行读取操作。The following example performs a read operation on both streams. 它通过对 流执行异步读取操作来避免死锁情况。It avoids the deadlock condition by performing asynchronous read operations on the stream. 如果父进程调用 `p.StandardOutput.ReadToEnd` 后跟 `p.StandardError.ReadToEnd` 并且子进程写入足够多的文本以填充其错误流，则会导致死锁情况。A deadlock condition results if the parent process calls `p.StandardOutput.ReadToEnd` followed by `p.StandardError.ReadToEnd` and the child process writes enough text to fill its error stream. 父进程会无限期地等待子进程关闭其 流。The parent process would wait indefinitely for the child process to close its stream. 子进程会无限期地等待父进程从完整的 流中读取。The child process would wait indefinitely for the parent to read from the full stream. [!code-csharp[Reading from both streams](~/samples/snippets/csharp/api/system.diagnostics/process/standardoutput/stdoutput-async.cs)] [!code-vb[Reading from both streams](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/api/system.diagnostics/process/standardoutput/stdoutput-async.vb)] 您可以使用异步读取操作来避免这些依赖项及其死锁。You can use asynchronous read operations to avoid these dependencies and their deadlock potential. 或者，您可以通过创建两个线程并在单独的线程上读取每个流的输出来避免出现死锁情况。Alternately, you can avoid the deadlock condition by creating two threads and reading the output of each stream on a separate thread. > [!NOTE] > 不能对重定向的流混合使用异步和同步读取操作。You cannot mix asynchronous and synchronous read operations on a redirected stream. 在异步或同步模式下打开 的重定向流后，对该流进行的所有进一步读取操作都必须处于相同的模式下。Once the redirected stream of a is opened in either asynchronous or synchronous mode, all further read operations on that stream must be in the same mode. 例如，不要在 流的 调用 ，反之亦然。For example, do not follow with a call to on the stream, or vice versa. 但是，可以在不同模式下读取两个不同的流。However, you can read two different streams in different modes. 例如，可以调用 ，然后调用 流的 。For example, you can call and then call for the stream. ## Examples 下面的示例将 `net use` 命令与用户提供的参数一起使用，以映射网络资源。The following example uses the `net use` command together with a user supplied argument to map a network resource. 然后，它读取 net 命令的标准错误流并将其写入控制台。It then reads the standard error stream of the net command and writes it to console. [!code-cpp[Process_StandardError#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process_StandardError/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Process_StandardError#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process_StandardError/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Process_StandardError#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process_StandardError/VB/source.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property StandardInput As StreamWriter
public: property System::IO::StreamWriter ^ StandardInput { System::IO::StreamWriter ^ get(); };

summary.span: 获取用于写入应用程序输入的流。

span.span: Gets a stream used to write the input of the application.

value.span: ，可用于写入应用程序的标准输入流。

span.span: A that can be used to write the standard input stream of the application.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以从其标准输入流（通常是键盘）读取输入文本。A can read input text from its standard input stream, typically the keyboard. 通过重定向 流，你可以通过编程方式指定输入。By redirecting the stream, you can programmatically specify the input. 例如，可以从指定文件的内容或其他应用程序的输出中提供文本，而不使用键盘输入。For example, instead of using keyboard input, you can provide text from the contents of a designated file or output from another application. > [!NOTE] > 若要使用 ，你必须将 设置为 `false`，并且必须将 设置为 `true`。To use , you must set to `false`, and you must set to `true`. 否则，写入 流时将引发异常。Otherwise, writing to the stream throws an exception. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何重定向进程的 流。The following example illustrates how to redirect the stream of a process. 该示例通过重定向的输入启动 `sort` 命令。The example starts the `sort` command with redirected input. 然后，它会提示用户输入文本，并通过重定向的 流将其传递到 `sort` 进程。It then prompts the user for text, and passes that to the `sort` process by means of the redirected stream. `sort` 结果在控制台上显示给用户。The `sort` results are displayed to the user on the console. [!code-cpp[Process_StandardInput#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process_StandardInput/CPP/process_standardinput.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Process_StandardInput#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process_StandardInput/CS/process_standardinput.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Process_StandardInput#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Process_StandardInput/VB/process_standardinput.vb#1)]
